Package sokoban

Class GameLogic

java.lang.Object
java.awt.event.KeyAdapter
sokoban.GameLogic
All Implemented Interfaces:
KeyListener, EventListener
public class GameLogic extends KeyAdapter
GameLogic class, responsible for the most important logic implementations such as moves. Connects the UI and the File process basically.

  • Method Details

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Getter for a gameLogic's board.
      Returns:
      - returns a Board Object

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard​(Board board)
      Setter for a gameLogic's board
      Parameters:
      board - - Sets the parametric board as the new value of the gameLogic's board

    • countBox

      public int countBox​(Board board)
      Method which counts the Box Object on an opened Board.
      Parameters:
      board - - Opened board, that is the game currently played on
      Returns:
      - returns an int, representing the number of boxes not on goals.

    • moveLogic

      public Coord moveLogic​(KeyEvent e, Board board)
      Most important method of the program. Responsible for all the operations on a Board Object.
      Parameters:
      e - - KeyEvent, is responsible for all keyboard inputs
      board - - Gets the current Board Object, so it can alter the data
      Returns:
      - returns a coordinate, so the player's position is known for the next "iteration" of the gameloop

    • isFinished

      public boolean isFinished()
      Method that checks whether the number of boxes that are not on goals equal 0.
      Returns:
      - true/false depending on the value of the comparison

    • getSteps

      public int getSteps()
      Getter for the steps made, so it can be updated
      Returns:
      - an int, representing the number of steps made

    • setSteps

      public void setSteps​(int steps)
      Setter for steps variable, so it can be "iterated" during a loop.
      Parameters:
      steps - - the previous value of the variable
